## Quarto

Quarto enables you to weave together content and executable code into a finished document. To learn more about Quarto see <https://quarto.org>.

## Running Code

When you click the **Render** button a document will be generated that includes both content and the output of embedded code. You can embed code like this:

```{r}
1 + 1
```

You can add options to executable code like this

```{r}
#| echo: false
2 * 2
```

The `echo: false` option disables the printing of code (only output is displayed).

```{r}
install.packages("arrow")      # para parquet

library(arrow)

# Criando um tibble simples
df <- tibble::tibble(
  id = 1:3,
  nome = c("Alice", "Bruno", "Carla"),
  idade = c(25, 30, 22)
)

# Salvando como Parquet
write_parquet(df, "exemplo.parquet")

# Lendo de volta
df_lido <- read_parquet("exemplo.parquet")
print(df_lido)
```

```{r}

install.packages("jsonlite")

# Carregar o pacote
library(jsonlite)

# Criar um data.frame de exemplo
df <- data.frame(
  id = 1:3,
  nome = c("Alice", "Bruno", "Carla"),
  idade = c(25, 30, 22)
)

# Salvar como JSON
write_json(df, "exemplo.json", pretty = TRUE)

# Ler de volta o JSON
df_json <- read_json("exemplo.json", simplifyVector = TRUE)

print(df_json)
```
